posts._title: Jerzy Stuhr – Duze zwierze AKA Big Animal (2000)
posts.title: Duze zwierze
posts.excerpt: Quote:Mr. Zygmunt Sawicki is a bank employee, who finds a camel in his yard one day. He decides to take charge of it and he and his wife Marysia take care of it. However, problems arise for both his fellow town-dwellers and the local authorities.

posts.title: Who Killed Who?
posts.excerpt: STORYLINE:A man is murdered, and the detective tries to find out whodunit. But the house he’s investigating is decidedly haunted, and he never knows just what’s round the next corner…

posts._title: Emir Kusturica – Sjecas Li Se, Dolly Bell ? aka Do you remember, Dolly Bell ? (1981)
posts.title: Sjecas Li Se, Dolly Bell ?
posts.excerpt: SYNOPSIS: (from the Artificial Eye release)As Hollywood movies begin to find their way into the country, sixteen year-old Dino becomes seduced by the glamour of the gangster films that flash before his eyes at the local cinema. Determining to follow a life of crime himself, Dino falls in with a band of petty crooks until …

posts.title: Los amores cobardes (2018)
posts.excerpt: Eva is a young and independent cartoonist who returns to Málaga (Spain) to spend the summer holidays. There she meets her mother and Gema, her best friend. What she does not expect is to meet again with Rubén, her old boyfriend, with whom she has not had any contact since he broke off all relations …

posts._title: Bo Widerberg – Kvarteret Korpen aka Raven’s End (1963)
posts.title: Kvarteret Korpen
posts.excerpt: By Roger Ebert / March 20, 1972The young man looks at the empty lives of the people living on his block, and writes an angry book about the way they’ve been treated. A publisher invites him to Stockholm to discuss the manuscript, but finally patronizes him: “There is a cry of rage here, but it …

posts._title: Alain Guiraudie – Pas de repos pour les braves AKA No Rest for the Brave (2003)
posts.title: Pas de repos pour les braves
posts.excerpt: First of all there is Basile Matin, a young man who dreamt of Fafatao-Laoupo, symbol of the penultimate sleep… Now he knows that he will die if he ever falls asleep again in his life. The problem is, that at his age you still like to think that you have your life before you. And …

posts._title: Gust Van den Berghe – Blue Bird (2011)
posts.title: Blue Bird
posts.excerpt: Blue Bird is a story about how one day in a child’s life can change its world. One morning, Bafiokadié and his sister Téné, two African children, leave their village. The only thing on their mind is to find their lost blue bird before the day is over. But they will find much more along …

posts._title: Ventura Pons – Barcelona (un mapa) AKA Barcelona: A Map (2007)
posts.title: Barcelona (un mapa)
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Timid, elderly Ramon once worked at a Barcelona theater, later burned down, where he enjoyed dressing up in women’s costumes. He’s now married to Ros and owns a house whose rooms he has rented out.Wishing to spend his last days in peace, Ramon visits his tenants to ask them to leave.

posts._title: Yossi Madmoni & David Ofek – Ha-Mangalistim AKA The Barbecue People [+Extras] (2003)
posts.title: Ha-Mangalistim
posts.excerpt: A family of Iraqi-Israelis, each with his or her own weaknesses and determination, gathers for an Independence Day picnic. Their background stories are presented, reaching back as little as a few days or as far back as the War of Independence and the old country before that, and interlocking in ways that even they never …

posts.title: Atti degli apostoli
